Key Match Events: Yamamoto pitched a perfect game with 6 1/3 innings, one hit, one earned run, two walks and four strikeouts.
Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the ninth inning
Juan Soto hit a home run in the third inning
Shohei Ohtani attempted to steal second base and sustained a shoulder injury
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers took a 2-0 lead in the World Series on Saturday.
Yamamoto's lone hit allowed was a home run from Juan Soto in the third inning.
Yamamoto's final line: 6 1/3 innings, one hit, one earned run, two walks and four strikeouts.
Shohei Ohtani attempted to steal second base and sustained a shoulder injury
Manager Dave Roberts referred to the injury postgame as a 'little' subluxation.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani's shoulder injury is concerning for the Dodgers.
The Dodgers' 2-0 lead in the World Series is significant.
The Yankees will need a win with Clarke Schmidt on the mound against Walker Buehler in Game 3 on Monday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was postponed until the next day due to rain delays.
The Dodgers ended a 20-year championship drought with this win.
